Frequently Asked Questions

Source: R/docs.R
faq.Rd

Please look at this before asking questions.

Package installation

How do I reinstall a package?

pak does not reinstall a package, if the same version is already installed. Sometimes you still want a reinstall, e.g. to fix a broken installation. In this case you can delete the package and then install it, or use the ?reinstall parameter:

pak::pkg_install("tibble")

#>                                                                                 
#> ‚Üí Will install 13 packages.                                                     
#> ‚Üí All 13 packages (7.45 MB) are cached.                                         
#> + cli         3.3.0                                                             
#> + crayon      1.5.1                                                             
#> + ellipsis    0.3.2                                                             
#> + fansi       1.0.3                                                             
#> + glue        1.6.2                                                             
#> + lifecycle   1.0.1                                                             
#> + magrittr    2.0.3                                                             
#> + pillar      1.7.0                                                             
#> + pkgconfig   2.0.3                                                             
#> + rlang       1.0.2                                                             
#> + tibble      3.1.7                                                             
#> + utf8        1.2.2                                                             
#> + vctrs       0.4.1                                                             
#> ‚Ñπ No downloads are needed, 13 pkgs (7.45 MB) are cached                         
#> ‚úî Got ellipsis 0.3.2 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (38.65 kB)                        
#> ‚úî Got lifecycle 1.0.1 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (107.55 kB)                      
#> ‚úî Got crayon 1.5.1 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (158.62 kB)                         
#> ‚úî Got glue 1.6.2 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (154.64 kB)                           
#> ‚úî Got pkgconfig 2.0.3 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (17.70 kB)                       
#> ‚úî Got utf8 1.2.2 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (209.24 kB)                           
#> ‚úî Got magrittr 2.0.3 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (231.25 kB)                       
#> ‚úî Got fansi 1.0.3 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (379.23 kB)                          
#> ‚úî Got cli 3.3.0 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (1.17 MB)                              
#> ‚úî Got pillar 1.7.0 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (744.33 kB)                         
#> ‚úî Got tibble 3.1.7 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (723.61 kB)                         
#> ‚úî Got vctrs 0.4.1 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (1.76 MB)                            
#> ‚úî Got rlang 1.0.2 (aarch64-apple-darwin20) (1.79 MB)                            
#> ‚úî Installed cli 3.3.0  (66ms)                                                   
#> ‚úî Installed crayon 1.5.1  (75ms)                                                
#> ‚úî Installed ellipsis 0.3.2  (85ms)                                              
#> ‚úî Installed fansi 1.0.3  (109ms)                                                
#> ‚úî Installed glue 1.6.2  (117ms)                                                 
#> ‚úî Installed lifecycle 1.0.1  (126ms)                                            
#> ‚úî Installed magrittr 2.0.3  (133ms)                                             
#> ‚úî Installed pillar 1.7.0  (151ms)                                               
#> ‚úî Installed pkgconfig 2.0.3  (36ms)                                             
#> ‚úî Installed rlang 1.0.2  (56ms)                                                 
#> ‚úî Installed tibble 3.1.7  (40ms)                                                
#> ‚úî Installed utf8 1.2.2  (38ms)                                                  
#> ‚úî Installed vctrs 0.4.1  (28ms)                                                 
#> ‚úî 1 pkg + 12 deps: added 13, dld 13 (7.48 MB) [4.7s]                            


pak::pkg_install("tibble?reinstall")

#>                                                                                 
#> ‚Üí Will install 1 package.                                                       
#> ‚Üí The package (724.32 kB) is cached.                                            
#> + tibble   3.1.7                                                                
#> ‚Ñπ No downloads are needed, 1 pkg (724.32 kB) is cached                          
#> ‚úî Installed tibble 3.1.7  (27ms)                                                
#> ‚úî 1 pkg + 12 deps: kept 11, added 1 [746ms]

How do I install a package from source?

To force the installation of a source package (instead of a binary package), use the ?source parameter:

pak::pkg_install("tibble?source")

#>                                                                                 
#> ‚Üí Will install 1 package.                                                       
#> ‚Üí The package (672.34 kB) is cached.                                            
#> + tibble   3.1.7 üë∑üèºüîß                                                            
#> ‚Ñπ No downloads are needed, 1 pkg (672.34 kB) is cached                          
#> ‚úî Got tibble 3.1.7 (source) (674.87 kB)                                         
#> ‚Ñπ Building tibble 3.1.7                                                         
#> ‚úî Built tibble 3.1.7 (2.8s)                                                     
#> ‚úî Installed tibble 3.1.7  (26ms)                                                
#> ‚úî 1 pkg + 12 deps: kept 11, added 1, dld 1 (674.87 kB) [8.2s]

How do I ignore an optional dependency?

pak::pkg_install(
  c("tibble", "DiagrammeR=?ignore", "formattable=?ignore"),
  dependencies = TRUE
)

#> ‚Üí Will install 84 packages.                                                     
#> ‚Üí Will download 67 CRAN packages (59.08 MB), cached: 17 (16.78 MB).             
#> + askpass        1.1     ‚¨á (22.91 kB)

The syntax is

<packagename>=?ignore

Note that you can only ignore optional dependencies, i.e. packages in Suggests and Enhances.

Others

How can I use pak with renv?

You cannot currently, but keep on eye on this issue: https://github.com/r-lib/pak/issues/343
